title: Dingle Dangle Dongle
name: Dingle Dangle Dongle
description:
A Map by Hesterdingle

My life on a map.

properties.name: Albuquerque
properties.description: Posted by HesterdingleI lived in Albuquerque for about 5 years. My little brother Zane was born there and shortly after his birth we moved to Las Vegas. Most of my embarrasing child photos for some reason come from when I lived in Albuquerque. Also, the Navajo Indians would have a yearly celebration and I\'d always join in with the dancing and whatnot. I\'m glad there aren\'t photos.

properties.name: Dingle, Ireland
properties.description: Posted by Baaghdingle irelandMy 1st stop, 2nd week in Ireland. After dropping Jeni off at Dublin airport, I took the train to Tralee followed by a bus ride into Dingle. What a beautiful place. I spent the 2nd week hiking around the peninsula and met some nice travellers from Europe and the States here

properties.name: Home of Ben & Jerry's
properties.description: Posted by HesterdingleI was born in Morrisville, Vermont but lived in Stowe,VT. My dad was a ski bum until he was 21 while my mom went to college. They met while working at the Green Mountain Inn. My parents designed and built the house and it was in the middle of a forest. I lived there for two years and my parents decided the house was too small since my sister was on the way. I\'ve been back to the area many many times.

properties.name: I can build a house!
properties.description: Posted by Hesterdingletijuana, mexicoFor two summers in a row I went with my best friend to help build houses with her church down in Tijuana. I had a good two years of Espanol under my belt so I could successfully talk with the little kids. I even received little kid artwork. Going down there definitly gives you a reality check and how much running water and flushable toilets are taken for granted.

properties.name: I'm right here
properties.description: Posted by Hesterdingle1200 E Colton Ave, Redlands, CA, 92374As you may of concluded, this is where I\'m currently living. Who would of known?

properties.name: Odyssey of the Mind 1
properties.description: Posted by HesterdingleIn third grade I joined Odyssey of the Mind and my team made it to the world competition which was held in Baltimore. We travelled around Washington D.C. and I was able to see all those sites you see in history books. Yeah!

properties.name: Odyssey of the mind 2
properties.description: Posted by HesterdingleIn fifth grade we made it to the world competition in Knoxville, TN. We went to the Smokey Mountain Nation Park and then that was just about it.

properties.name: Santa Fe
properties.description: Posted by Hesterdingle526 Galisteo St, santa fe, nmI lived in Santa Fe for a couple of years. My sister was born here and we lived in two different houses during our time in Santa Fe. One of the houses was made out of adobe bricks. I don\'t remember any of it.

properties.name: Santa Fe, New Mexico
properties.description: Posted by Bluenude3Â 526 Galisteo St, santa fe, nmCrystal and I came with high expectations of going to the Georgia O\'Keefe museum, but alas it was a Monday. We did eat at one of my favorite restaurants - Cafe Oasis. Another must see is the market at the square and Loretto Chapel staircase which is considered a miracle, as it was built without nails. I stayed again in Santa Fe in 2001 when Aaron and I visited. This time we got to see the Georgia O\'Keeffe museum!

properties.name: There's a street with my name
properties.description: Posted by Hesterdingle

properties.name: Tijuana, Mexico
properties.description: Posted by Camknowstijuana, mexicoI built houses for people here.

properties.name: University of Redlands
properties.description: Posted by System1200 E Colton Ave, Redlands, CA, 92374(909) 335-4003

properties.name: Vancouver, BC
properties.description: Posted by Cameronvancouver canadaLike Portland, Vancouver is an extrememly "livable" city. On my one short trip there I was overwhelmed with the kindness and friendliness of the people there and the beauty of the city itself. When crossing the border into Canada on my only trip to BC thus far the crossing guard asked where we were going to. I said, "Vancouver." He asked where we were coming from. I said, "Vancouver!" as in Vancouver, WA. I thought it was hysterical - the crossing guard not so much. Vancouver seems at the same time so much like the U.S. and so much NOT like the U.S. It\'s different enough, yet familiar enough for me to want to call it Home.

properties.name: Viva Las Vegas
properties.description: Posted by Hesterdingle2703 sandalwood ave, henderson, nv 89074In 1993 my family moved to Henderson which is a suburb of Las Vegas. We planned to live there for only 3 years but we ended up living there for 10 years. I went to public schools until my freshman year of high school where I attended a magnet performing arts school. For the first time whites were the minority race in the school. A month into school I was shipped up to Bellingham, WA. There is nothing to do in Vegas when you are underage besides swimming, walking around in air conditioned stores/malls, watching movies, and just staying inside since the temperature reaches the 120s. The city is owned and run by Mormons and a lot of the jobs are held by Mexican immigrants.

properties.name: Where the name comes from
properties.description: Posted by Hesterdingledingle irelandMy dad is a full blood Irish man. This is where my name comes from.
